FuncDef:
The permit no-tls command configures a security policy for a gRPC server to allow selected services to run on an unencrypted gRPC channel.
The undo permit no-tls command restores the default security policy of a gRPC server. The permit no-tls command configures a security policy for a gRPC server to allow selected services to run on an unencrypted gRPC channel. The undo permit no-tls command restores the default security policy of a gRPC server. By default, services are not allowed to run on an unencrypted gRPC channel.
Examples: Warning: If no SSL policy is configured, the selected service is allowed to run. Continue? [Y/N]:y
ExtraInfo: The permit no-tls command configures a security policy for a gRPC server to allow selected services to run on an unencrypted gRPC channel.
